title: Calories in Two Scrambled Eggs
meta_description: Discover calories in two scrambled eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and simple tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with 1 tsp butter total (no milk, cheese, or other add-ins); cooked until set.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, cooking fat amount, add-ins, and method; values approximate—check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: Two large scrambled eggs provide ~182 kcal and ~12 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use oil instead of butter (1 tsp total)

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What are the macros for two scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: ≈13 g protein, 13 g fat, 1 g carbs.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have more calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added cooking fat—~91 kcal vs. ~78 kcal per large egg.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: More butter or oil increases fat and calories; non-stick pans reduce added fat.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, two large eggs have ~386 mg, mostly from yolks—consider dietary needs.
